inclusion.criterion: History of acromegaly with biochemical cure documented
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: known case of Acromegaly who underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago

inclusion.criterion: At the time of enrollment a minimum of 6 months must have elapsed since surgery.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: GHD due to surgical or radiation treatment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: GHD will be defined as a peak plasma GH of less than 5 ng/ml in response to an insulin tolerance test or a GH-releasing hormone (GHRH) plus arginine stimulation test
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: GHD will also be diagnosed if IGF-I levels are below 2 standard deviations for the age-sex normal range in a patient with at least two other documented anterior pituitary hormone deficiencies
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: IGF-1 level of 4.5 ULN adjusted by sex and age

exclusion.criterion: History of malignancy except for non-melanoma skin cancer
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Hepatic or renal disease (aspartate aminotransferase (AST) or alanine aminotransferase (ALT) > 3x upper limit of normal (ULN) or creatinine level >2.5 mg/dl)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association's classification system Class II-IV congestive heart failure (CHF) will be excluded)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Unstable cardiovascular disease (coronary artery or cerebrovascular disease) or symptoms within one year prior to entry into the study
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Initiation or discontinuation of gonadal steroid therapy within 3 months of entry
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of acromegaly and underwent surgery. IGF-1 level is slightly elevated, but GH level is normal.
